title: Foundation: Apprenticeship and Basic Knowledge
description: While formal education beyond O/L is not required, a good understanding of basic science and math is helpful. The best way to start is by working as a helper or apprentice to an experienced plumber.
institutes: Apprenticeship with a local plumber or construction company

title: Vocational Training (NVQ Level 3 & 4)
description: To gain professional recognition and structured knowledge, enroll in a Plumbing course at a vocational training institute. This will teach you the theory behind plumbing systems, standards, and best practices, leading to an NVQ qualification.

title: Qualified Plumber
description: Work as a qualified plumber for a construction company, a maintenance department, or as a self-employed professional. You will be responsible for installing, maintaining, and repairing water, drainage, and sanitation systems in buildings.

title: Master Plumber / Specialization
description: Become a master plumber, capable of handling large and complex plumbing systems for commercial buildings, hotels, or factories. You can specialize in areas like fire sprinkler systems, water treatment plants, or solar hot water systems.

title: Plumbing Contractor / Business Owner
description: With a strong reputation and business skills, you can establish your own plumbing contracting company. This involves bidding for projects, managing teams of plumbers, handling finances, and ensuring the successful completion of plumbing work for large construction projects.
